com.google.inject.spi
Interface InjectableType<I>

public interface InjectableType<I>

Represents an injectable type. A type is injectable if:

  1. Guice can inject its constructor, or
  2. Guice can inject the methods and fields of a pre-existing instance of the type

Note: Despite generic type erasure, Guice keeps track of full types, so it can and does treat Foo<String> and Foo<Integer> as distinct injectable types.

Since:
2.0

getInjectableConstructor

InjectionPoint getInjectableConstructor()
Returns the injection point representing the contructor or null if no injectable constructor is present

getInjectableMembers

Set<InjectionPoint> getInjectableMembers()
                                         throws ConfigurationException
Returns the instance methods and fields of T that can be injected.

Returns:
a possibly empty set of injection points. The set has a specified iteration order. All fields are returned and then all methods. Within the fields, supertype fields are returned before subtype fields. Similarly, supertype methods are returned before subtype methods.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - if there is a malformed injection point on the class of instance, such as a field with multiple binding annotations. The exception's partial value is a Set<InjectionPoint> of the valid injection points.

getMethodInterceptors

Map<Method,List<MethodInterceptor>> getMethodInterceptors()
Returns the interceptors applied to each method, in the order that they will be applied. These only apply when Guice instantiates I.

Returns:
a possibly empty map
